message:
انا عندى سؤالين مهمين وتقليدين جدا : 

1- Do you think that  applying for jobs( submit applications) on online jobs recruitment websites (Linkedin , wuzzuf , ....) is valuable ?

2- do companies like amazaon , google check their careers websites submitted applications ?!

data.message:
1.There is no useless effort in searching for jobs.. At least you learn .. It is just you don't stop at dropping your CV their and stay home waiting ...

2. If you mean the CV applied on the job website of Google or Amazon or whatever ... The answer is yes if you are not in middle East and you did a very professional cv. 

If you are in Egypt or Middle East the only way is to be referred by a friend who knows that you are good ... Or if you are still a student is to join programming contests such as ACM ACPC .. Or if you have missed this opportunity then to shine on contests websites such as topcoder and codeforces .... Etc

Google does check the resumes submitted on their website, at least for internships. I know those who got interviews just by submitting their resumes there.
But for sure you'll more likely get an interview if you've been referred by someone who works there.
For question 2: They do, but of course referrals are always a shortcut

Every job application counts, regardless of whatever they check it or not, you learn what's in the market and what companies are looking for

For big corporate, in Egypt internal referrals seems to work more than applying directly; and it's almost the same abroad, but I was surprised when I received a call for interview from Google by just applying directly without any referrals nor even a standing CV from a junior applicant back then 8 years ago; but this didn't happen again when I applied recently at Wikipedia and Google again
Thanks you guys for your help and time

Yes they do check them, and I got replies from applying online for Google. But referrals are waaaaaaaay faster and more reliable when it comes to big companies because of the massive amount of applications. 

Startups however are faster and do check their online submissions, udacity for example (where I now work) pride themselves of replying within 48 hours max
